eshmun.expression.guard

Class AtomicGuardExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.expression.guard.GuardExpression
      • eshmun.expression.guard.AtomicGuardExpression

  • public class AtomicGuardExpression
extends GuardExpression
    Represents an Atomic Guard.
    Author:
    kinan Atomic guards are the building block for guard expressions. They are formatted like this: (the guard's boolean expression) -> (var1:=val1); (var2:=val2); ... The boolean expression is saved as an AbstractExpression, while the assignments are a list of boolean variables. The names of these variables contain the assignment and value as well.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • satisfyGuard

        public java.util.HashSet<java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> satisfyGuard(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> state,
                                                                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processes)
                                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Given the current state of processes and shared variables, determine if this guard is satisfied.
        Specified by:
        satisfyGuard in class GuardExpression
        Parameters:
        state - a collection of labels and shared variables (with assignments).
        processes - a list of considered process indices, any boolean variable that does not belong to these processes is not considered.
        Returns:
        a set of effects and action names. Actions begin with "@". The outer set represents a "disjunction", in other words. Each of its elements is the effect of a separate transition. The inner set represents a "conjunction", its elements are concatenated into a single effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state does not satisfy the guard.

      • simplify

        public GuardExpression simplify()
        Description copied from class: GuardExpression
        Simplifies the guard. Turns the guard into the following format: ( ( Guard1 -> Assignment 1 (OR) Guard2 -> Assignment 2 (OR) ... ) (AND) ( Guard3 -> Asssignment3 (OR) ...) (AND) ... ) This also combines expression that have the same guard or the same assignments.
        Specified by:
        simplify in class GuardExpression
        Returns:
        a cloned (shallow copy) instance, this is an atomic expression which cannot be simplified more.

      • directCompare

        protected boolean directCompare(GuardExpression exp)
        Equality check, this method is only called if the passed expression has the same type as this.

        The internals of the implementation of this method depends on the implementing class.

        Comparison is not done based on pointers rather than based on semantic meaning. Two Expressions are equal if they consist of the same variables (based on Name), and if these variables are connected in the same way.

        Notice that certain Operators are commutative, this doesn't change the equality of two Expression.

        Specified by:
        directCompare in class GuardExpression
        Parameters:
        exp - the guard expression to compare this with.
        Returns:
        true if this and the passed object are semantically equal (as Expressions), false otherwise.

      • clone

        public AtomicGuardExpression clone()
        Clones this GuardExpression.

        Please note that while GuardExpression is copied, it is a shallow copy. The assignment list is copied but not the elements themselves, similarly the guard is copied by reference.

        Specified by:
        clone in class GuardExpression
        Returns:
        a shallow copy of this GuardExpression.
